topbar.connectFail: No running service detected. Ensure openakita serve is started.
topbar.startFail: Service failed to start. Check config.

tokenStats.serviceNotRunning: Service not running, unable to view stats
tokenStats.title: Token Usage Statistics
tokenStats.disclaimer: ⚠ Local token counts may differ from provider billing. Actual usage is subject to the provider's data. Stats here are for reference only.

chat.placeholder: Type a message... (Enter to send, Shift+Enter for newline)
chat.emptyDesc: Send a message to the AI assistant to begin
chat.serviceHint: Chat requires the backend service running. Start this workspace's service or connect to an existing serve instance.
chat.title: AI Chat Assistant
chat.queueHint: Enter to queue | Ctrl+Enter to send now

skills.title: Skill Manager
skills.noSkillsHint: Complete setup or install from marketplace
skills.noResults: No matching skills found, try different keywords

status.title: System Status
status.autostartHint: Auto-launch desktop app and backend service on boot
status.autoUpdateHint: Automatically check for new versions and notify you when available
status.degradedHint: Backend process is alive but HTTP is unreachable. It may be busy processing. Wait or restart manually.
status.degradedAutoClean: If the process heartbeat stays stale for ~60s, the system will automatically clean up the hung process.
status.backendNotRunningHint: Chat, IM channels, skills and other features require the backend service. Click the button to start it.
status.backendDiedDesc: The backend process has exited. Check logs or restart the service.
status.stopFailed: Service is still running. You may need to stop the process manually.
status.troubleshootTip: If the service is stuck, try manually killing the process and restarting.
status.troubleshootRestart: Consider closing and reopening the desktop app.
status.autoStartBackendHint: Automatically start the backend when the desktop app opens (works for both manual launch and autostart)
status.needServiceRunning: Start or connect to a service before running health checks

config.wsHint: Each workspace maintains independent config files for different environments
config.wsEmpty: No workspaces yet, create one first
config.pyHint: Recommended: built-in Python. Or use system Python 3.11+
config.installSourceHint: Default PyPI, or GitHub / local source
config.pyReady: Python is ready. Proceed to next step.
config.installDoneNext: Installed. Proceed to configure LLM endpoints.
config.wsDesc: Each workspace maintains independent .env and config files
config.imPairingCodeNotGenerated: Not yet generated (auto-generated on service start)
config.applyRestartHint: Save config and restart service to apply
config.restartNotRunning: Service not running, config saved (will apply on next start)
config.toolsHint: Manage Skills, MCP integrations, Desktop Automation, and Network Proxy
config.toolsNoSkills: No skills found (complete install step first)
config.agentHint: Persona selection, living presence, and core parameters. Advanced settings are collapsed by default.
config.agentDesktopNotifyEnableHelp: Show system notification when tasks are completed
config.agentDesktopNotifySoundHelp: Play system alert sound with desktop notifications
config.toolsMCPEnableHelp: Connect external MCP services and tools
config.toolsVisionHelp: Vision model for screen understanding and element location
config.toolsGithubHelp: For searching and downloading skills from GitHub
config.agentAutoConfirmHelp: Auto-approve tool calls without human review (use with caution)
config.agentProactiveEnableHelp: Allow Agent to proactively send greetings/reminders
config.imWeworkCorpIdHelp: Found at bottom of 'My Corp → Corp Info' page in WeCom admin
config.imWeworkTokenHelp: From Smart Bot 'Receive Messages' server config
config.imWeworkAesKeyHelp: From Smart Bot 'Receive Messages' server config
config.imWeworkCallbackUrlHint: In WeCom admin 'Receive Messages' server config, set URL to:
config.imQQBotModeWsHint: WebSocket: No public IP needed, SDK connects to QQ server (recommended)
config.imQQBotModeWhHint: Webhook: QQ server pushes events to your HTTP endpoint, requires public IP/domain
config.imOneBotTokenHint: Access token for your OneBot implementation (optional)
config.quickFinishHint: Quick setup is complete. Click below to launch the service and start using OpenAkita.

llm.title: LLM Endpoints
llm.subtitle: Configure AI model endpoints with auto-failover
llm.editProviderHint: Provider is set at creation and cannot be changed
llm.noEndpoints: No endpoints yet. Click above to add one.
llm.modelPlaceholder: Enter model name, e.g. glm-4, gpt-4o-mini
llm.baseUrlHint: Modify when using a proxy or relay service
llm.codingPlanHint: Use the provider's Coding Plan dedicated endpoint and protocol
llm.advRpmLimitHint: Max requests per minute, 0 = no limit
llm.compilerHint: Lightweight model for preprocessing, use a fast small model
llm.sttHint: Online speech recognition, supports OpenAI Whisper / DashScope Qwen-ASR / Groq / SiliconFlow. Falls back to local Whisper if not configured.
llm.noStt: No STT endpoints configured (will use local Whisper)
llm.testForbidden: Access denied, check API Key permissions
llm.testNotFound: Endpoint not found, check API URL
llm.localKeyPlaceholder: Local service, no API Key needed
llm.localHint: Local services (Ollama / LM Studio) don't require a real API Key, a placeholder has been auto-filled
llm.fetchSuccess: Successfully fetched {{count}} models, please select one
llm.fetchErrorNetwork: Cannot reach the provider, please check API URL and network
llm.fetchErrorAuth: Invalid or expired API Key, please verify and retry
llm.fetchErrorForbidden: Insufficient API Key permissions, please check access rights
llm.fetchErrorNotFound: API URL is incorrect, model list endpoint not found
llm.fetchErrorTimeout: Request timed out, please check network or try again later
llm.fetchErrorLocalNotRunning: Local service is not running, please start {{provider}} first
llm.fetchErrorEmpty: Provider returned an empty model list, please check account quota or API URL

welcome.title: Setup Guide
welcome.subtitle: Follow these steps to initialize OpenAkita. Each step guides you through key configurations.
welcome.step1: Create or select an isolated workspace
welcome.step2: Prepare the Python environment (built-in or system)
welcome.step3: Create venv and install the openakita package
welcome.step4: Add LLM providers, fetch model lists, and configure endpoints
welcome.step5: IM channels, tools & skills, Agent system, and other advanced settings
welcome.modeSubtitle: Quick start or customize every detail.
welcome.quickDesc: Auto-configure environment, just add 1 LLM endpoint to get started
welcome.fullDesc: Step-by-step configuration for advanced users who need full control
welcome.quickFormHint: Configure LLM endpoints (required) first. IM channels are optional. Click "Start Setup" when ready.
welcome.quickFormImHint: Configure Telegram, Feishu, or other IM channels here. You can skip this and still use the tool normally.
welcome.quickFormNeedEndpoint: Please add at least 1 LLM endpoint first
welcome.quickSetupSubtitle: Please wait, preparing the optimal setup for you...
welcome.quickStepFail: Auto-setup failed. You can switch to Full Setup to complete manually.

common.confirmDeleteMsg: Are you sure you want to delete

connect.title: Connect to Remote Service
connect.hint: Enter the address of a running OpenAkita service (default port 18900)
connect.fail: Cannot connect to service. Check the address and ensure the service is running

conflict.title: Existing Service Detected
conflict.message: An OpenAkita service is already running on local port 18900

version.mismatchDetail: Backend version {{backend}} differs from desktop version {{desktop}}, which may cause issues.

welcome.title: Welcome to OpenAkita
welcome.desc: Your all-in-one self-evolving AI Agent. Let's get you set up quickly.
welcome.advancedLink: Advanced user? Use the full configuration wizard
welcome.serviceDetectedDesc: A local OpenAkita service is already running (version {{version}}). You can connect to it directly.

onboarding.skipHint: You can skip this step and complete the setup later in the Settings panel.

llm.title: Configure AI Model
llm.desc: Add at least one LLM endpoint (API Key). OpenAkita will use it to think and act.

im.title: IM Channels (Optional)
im.desc: Connect Telegram, Feishu, DingTalk and other messaging platforms to let AI serve you directly in chat.

modules.title: Feature Modules
modules.desc: Select optional feature modules to install. Unselected modules can be installed later in settings.

system.title: CLI & System Settings
system.desc: Register command-line tools and configure system options like auto-start.

autostart.label: Launch at Startup
autostart.desc: Automatically start the desktop app and backend service when you log in

progress.title: Setting up...
progress.serviceStartFailed: ⚠ Service start failed: {{error}} (can start manually later)

done.title: Setup Complete!
done.desc: OpenAkita is ready. Begin your AI journey.
done.errorsHint: You can reinstall failed modules in settings.

modules.title: Module Management
modules.desc: Manage optional feature module installation and removal. Restart backend service after changes.
modules.restartDesc: Module "{{name}}" changes are complete. A backend restart is needed for changes to take effect. Restart now?
modules.uninstallFailInUse: Uninstall failed: module files may be in use by the backend. Stop the backend service first, then try again.
